commit_list.message: Fix error with params hash returning inconsistent results.
environment.rb now boots the application. we just want to load it.

Shouldn't sanitize markdown in flash messages.

We aren't sanitizing pure text OR textile, so shouldn't sanitize this
either. Sanitize as needed *before* putting stuff in the flash.
PublicErrorsController has to inherit from ApplicationController.
I think we can rely on Rails autoloading.

Using Goalie as git submodule for now.

Will later turn into a gem.
I18n.load_path must be a flat array.

Running with Edge until Rails 3 final comes out.

This is so that I waste less time porting stuff in between test
versions, like I wasted porting from 3.0.0.beta4 to
3.0.0.rc. Hopefully I'll catch errors incrementally this way.
Pathname concatenation can't have leading slash.

Need to see production error pages locally.

http://helderribeiro.net/?p=357

Not buying into Rails3's lame XSS protection.

Not for now anyway.

For some reason params is coming empty.

Maybe it's due to the metaprogramming here, not sure. It would be nice
if someone took a look at this.

render :partial renders collection when passed array

Even if you pass it as :object => @tag_cloud, it still iterates over
the elements of the @tag_cloud array. The partials were expecting the
array and were getting each successive hash, so they were breaking.
Fixed that by passing the collection in the :locals hash.

Also replaced the deprecated '-' block syntax with Haml's new one
('=').

fix fix

Fixing stuff devise complained was deprecated.

:authenticatable now is :database_authenticatable;
:http_authenticatable is now on by default and doesn't have to be
declared.
'-' blocks are deprecated in favor of '=' in haml.

Replaced super_exception_notifier with exception_notification.

super_exception_notifier doesn't yet support rails3, so I changed to
the vanilla rails plugin at:
http://github.com/rails/exception_notification

There isn't a gem for it yet, so I built it and packed it with
bundler.

One disadvantage is that the vanilla plugin doesn't support giving the
notification additional data (like the current group). The advantage
is that it's rack-based and less intrusive, so easier for each shapado
user to replace later with Hoptoad, Exceptional or something else.
Fixed routes (to a bootable state anyway).

New default translation strings for devise.

TODO: translators should adapt their yml files to match the new
english one.
Email regex validation is done by devise by default.
Merged BadMinus-devise with plataformatec's v1.1.rc2 tag

$ bundle package

Used to include BadMinus-devise-1.1.rc1.gem. And all the rest can come
along too.
Need custom Devise for now because of MongoMapper.

Pathname concatenation can't have leading slash.

      > Rails.root
      => #<Pathname:/home/helder/code/shapado>
      > Rails.root + "/config/shapado.yml"
      => #<Pathname:/config/shapado.yml> # ERROR!
      > Rails.root + "config/shapado.yml"
      => #<Pathname:/home/helder/code/shapado/config/shapado.yml> # CORRECT

      So you can't have a leading '/' in the path string being
      concatenated with Rails.root.

Converted routes.

This is the output straight out of:
    rake rails:upgrade:routes

I removed the deprecated route:
  build_questions_routes(map, :path_prefix => '/:language',
   :name_prefix => "with_language_")

before running the conversion script.
Moving out stuff from environment.rb to application.rb
Show wget output when downloading geoip data.
Updated Rails version on README file.

Make sample files follow Rails standard.

Use *.yml.sample instead of *.sample.yml. Makes deployment a bit easier.

Moved code to extract participants from reviews and review requests to the appropriate models.

The list of participants can now be queried from the ReviewRequest and Review
models, instead of using a special function in the e-mail code.

Reviewed at http://reviews.reviewboard.org/r/939/

Merge branch 'master' into nose_bug

  Make sure the screenshot area is visible when showing a screenshot thumbnail.
  Add the release notes for 1.1 alpha 1 for tomorrow's release.
  Change the semantics of a Review Request's last activity information.
  Add improved autocomplete of groups and people.
  Allow for flexible build directories for the docs.
  New CSS fixes need Djblets 0.5.2.
  Update the admin UI templates/stylesheets for Django 1.1.
  Release Review Board 1.0.3.
  Update to require Django 1.1.
  Move the configuration templates into reviewboard/cmdline/conf/.
  Add a missing release note on the improved error logging.
  Fix a wrongly referenced evolution name. And we're retagging for release.
  Add a script for automating releases.
  Release Review Board 1.0.2.
  Add the release notes for Review Board 1.0.2.
  Fix expanding some collapsed diffs in interfilediffs.
  Increase the FileDiff filename limit to 1024 characters.
  Be more flexible with the memcached URI parsing for the Cache Stats page.
  Fix support for generating a mod_python config file with a non-'/' site root.
  Fix support for generating a mod_python config file with a non-'/' site root.
  ...

commit_list.message:
Fixes passing parameters to Nose when running tests.

./manage.py captures any parameter passed before an optional "--", so
running:

./manage.py test -s

to pass the -s to nose (to make it not capture stdout) doesn't work,
and manage.py dies with a "no such option" error. With this fix, this
works:

./manage.py test -- -s

commit_list.message:
Made po-cycle-auxiliary return home when key is untranslated.

Previously po-cycle-auxiliary only cycled through auxiliary files that
had an actual translation for the key in question.

The problem is that I mostly use po-cycle-auxiliary to check other
translations *before* starting my own, and the way it was,
po-cycle-auxiliary wouldn't return to the original (empty) string I
was about to translate. I had to iswithb-buffer back to it, and that
was annoying.

This comes at a cost of occasionaly going through untranslated entries
in other languages, but that's just another cheap tapping of 'a'.

Merge branch 'master' into nose_bug

* master: (59 commits)
  Make sure the screenshot area is visible when showing a screenshot thumbnail.
  Add the release notes for 1.1 alpha 1 for tomorrow's release.
  Change the semantics of a Review Request's last activity information.
  Add improved autocomplete of groups and people.
  Allow for flexible build directories for the docs.
  New CSS fixes need Djblets 0.5.2.
  Update the admin UI templates/stylesheets for Django 1.1.
  Release Review Board 1.0.3.
  Update to require Django 1.1.
  Move the configuration templates into reviewboard/cmdline/conf/.
  Add a missing release note on the improved error logging.
  Fix a wrongly referenced evolution name. And we're retagging for release.
  Add a script for automating releases.
  Release Review Board 1.0.2.
  Add the release notes for Review Board 1.0.2.
  Fix expanding some collapsed diffs in interfilediffs.
  Increase the FileDiff filename limit to 1024 characters.
  Be more flexible with the memcached URI parsing for the Cache Stats page.
  Fix support for generating a mod_python config file with a non-'/' site root.
  Fix support for generating a mod_python config file with a non-'/' site root.
  ...
commit_list.repo_description: Modified version of Review Board for teaching OS

commit_list.message:
Fixes passing parameters to Nose when running tests.

./manage.py captures any parameter passed before an optional "--", so
running:

./manage.py test -s

to pass the -s to nose (to make it not capture stdout) doesn't work,
and manage.py dies with a "no such option" error. With this fix, this
works:

./manage.py test -- -s

commit_list.message:
render :partial renders collection when passed array

Even if you pass it as :object => @tag_cloud, it still iterates over
the elements of the @tag_cloud array. The partials were expecting the
array and were getting each successive hash, so they were breaking.
Fixed that by passing the collection in the :locals hash.

Also replaced the deprecated '-' block syntax with Haml's new one
('=').

fix fix

commit_list.message:
Replaced super_exception_notifier with exception_notification.

super_exception_notifier doesn't yet support rails3, so I changed to
the vanilla rails plugin at:
http://github.com/rails/exception_notification

There isn't a gem for it yet, so I built it and packed it with
bundler.

One disadvantage is that the vanilla plugin doesn't support giving the
notification additional data (like the current group). The advantage
is that it's rack-based and less intrusive, so easier for each shapado
user to replace later with Hoptoad, Exceptional or something else.

commit_list.message:
Pathname concatenation can't have leading slash.

      > Rails.root
      => #<Pathname:/home/helder/code/shapado>
      > Rails.root + "/config/shapado.yml"
      => #<Pathname:/config/shapado.yml> # ERROR!
      > Rails.root + "config/shapado.yml"
      => #<Pathname:/home/helder/code/shapado/config/shapado.yml> # CORRECT

      So you can't have a leading '/' in the path string being
      concatenated with Rails.root.

commit_list.message:
render :partial renders collection when passed array

Even if you pass it as :object => @tag_cloud, it still iterates over
the elements of the @tag_cloud array. The partials were expecting the
array and were getting each successive hash, so they were breaking.
Fixed that by passing the collection in the :locals hash.

Also replaced the deprecated '-' block syntax with Haml's new one
('=').

fix fix

commit_list.message:
Replaced super_exception_notifier with exception_notification.

super_exception_notifier doesn't yet support rails3, so I changed to
the vanilla rails plugin at:
http://github.com/rails/exception_notification

There isn't a gem for it yet, so I built it and packed it with
bundler.

One disadvantage is that the vanilla plugin doesn't support giving the
notification additional data (like the current group). The advantage
is that it's rack-based and less intrusive, so easier for each shapado
user to replace later with Hoptoad, Exceptional or something else.

commit_list.message:
Pathname concatenation can't have leading slash.

      > Rails.root
      => #<Pathname:/home/helder/code/shapado>
      > Rails.root + "/config/shapado.yml"
      => #<Pathname:/config/shapado.yml> # ERROR!
      > Rails.root + "config/shapado.yml"
      => #<Pathname:/home/helder/code/shapado/config/shapado.yml> # CORRECT

      So you can't have a leading '/' in the path string being
      concatenated with Rails.root.

commit_list.message:
Merge branch 'master' into nose_bug

* master: (59 commits)
  Make sure the screenshot area is visible when showing a screenshot thumbnail.
  Add the release notes for 1.1 alpha 1 for tomorrow's release.
  Change the semantics of a Review Request's last activity information.
  Add improved autocomplete of groups and people.
  Allow for flexible build directories for the docs.
  New CSS fixes need Djblets 0.5.2.
  Update the admin UI templates/stylesheets for Django 1.1.
  Release Review Board 1.0.3.
  Update to require Django 1.1.
  Move the configuration templates into reviewboard/cmdline/conf/.
  Add a missing release note on the improved error logging.
  Fix a wrongly referenced evolution name. And we're retagging for release.
  Add a script for automating releases.
  Release Review Board 1.0.2.
  Add the release notes for Review Board 1.0.2.
  Fix expanding some collapsed diffs in interfilediffs.
  Increase the FileDiff filename limit to 1024 characters.
  Be more flexible with the memcached URI parsing for the Cache Stats page.
  Fix support for generating a mod_python config file with a non-'/' site root.
  Fix support for generating a mod_python config file with a non-'/' site root.
  ...

Fixes passing parameters to Nose when running tests.

./manage.py captures any parameter passed before an optional "--", so
running:

./manage.py test -s

to pass the -s to nose (to make it not capture stdout) doesn't work,
and manage.py dies with a "no such option" error. With this fix, this
works:

./manage.py test -- -s

Moved code to extract participants from reviews and review requests to the appropriate models.

The list of participants can now be queried from the ReviewRequest and Review
models, instead of using a special function in the e-mail code.

Reviewed at http://reviews.reviewboard.org/r/939/
